questions.question_text:

Given : Atomic masses of C, H and N are 12, 1 and 14 amu respectively.

The molar mass of the compound A is 162 g mol$$-$$1.
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question:
Compound A contains 8.7% Hydrogen, 74% Carbon and 17.3% Nitrogen. The molecular formula of the compound is, 
Given : Atomic masses of C, H and N are 12, 1 and 14 amu respectively. 
The molar mass of the compound A is 162 g mol^{$$-$$1}.

questions.question_text:
Consider the following statements :

(A) The principal quantum number 'n' is a positive integer with values of 'n' = 1, 2, 3, ...

(B) The azimuthal quantum number 'l' for a given 'n' (principal quantum number) can have values as 'l' = 0, 1, 2, ...... n

(C) Magnetic orbital quantum number 'ml' for a particular 'l' (azimuthal quantum number) has (2l + 1) values.

(D) $$\pm$$ 1/2 are the two possible orientations of electron spin.

(E) For l = 5, there will be a total of 9 orbital

Which of the above statements are correct?
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question:
Consider the following statements : 
(A) The principal quantum number 'n' is a positive integer with values of 'n' = 1, 2, 3, ... 
(B) The azimuthal quantum number 'l' for a given 'n' (principal quantum number) can have values as 'l' = 0, 1, 2, ...... n 
(C) Magnetic orbital quantum number 'm_{l}' for a particular 'l' (azimuthal quantum number) has (2l + 1) values. 
(D) $$\pm$$ 1/2 are the two possible orientations of electron spin. 
(E) For l = 5, there will be a total of 9 orbital 
Which of the above statements are correct?

questions.question_text: In the structure of SF4, the lone pair of electrons on S is in.
questions.subject: Chemistry

options.A: equatorial position and there are two lone pair - bond pair repulsions at 90$$^\circ$$.
options.B: equatorial position and there are three lone pair - bond pair repulsions at 90$$^\circ$$.
options.C: axial position and there are three lone pair - bond pair repulsion at 90$$^\circ$$.
options.D: axial position and there are two lone pair - bond pair repulsion at 90$$^\circ$$.

questions.question: In the structure of SF_{4}, the lone pair of electrons on S is in.

questions.question_text:
With respect to the following reaction, consider the given statements :

 

(A) o-Nitroaniline and p-nitroaniline are the predominant products.

(B) p-Nitroaniline and m-nitroaniline are the predominant products.

(C) HNO3 acts as an acid.

(D) H2SO4 acts as an acid.

Choose the correct option.
questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question:

(B) p-Nitroaniline and m-nitroaniline are the predominant products. 
(C) HNO_{3} acts as an acid. 
(D) H_{2}SO_{4} acts as an acid. 
Choose the correct option.

(Given : R = 0.083 L bar K$$-$$1 mol$$-$$1)

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question: If one of the diameters of the circle $${x^2} + {y^2} - 2\sqrt 2 x - 6\sqrt 2 y + 14 = 0$$ is a chord of the circle $${(x - 2\sqrt 2 )^2} + {(y - 2\sqrt 2 )^2} = {r^2}$$, then the value of r^{2} is equal to ____________.

questions.question_text: If $$\mathop {\lim }\limits_{x \to 1} {{\sin (3{x^2} - 4x + 1) - {x^2} + 1} \over {2{x^3} - 7{x^2} + ax + b}} =  - 2$$, then the value of (a $$-$$ b) is equal to ___________.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question: If $$\mathop {\lim }\limits_{x \to 1} {{\sin (3{x^2} - 4x + 1) - {x^2} + 1} \over {2{x^3} - 7{x^2} + ax + b}} =  - 2$$, then the value of (a $$-$$ b) is equal to ___________.

questions.question_text:
Let for n = 1, 2, ......, 50, Sn be the sum of the infinite geometric progression whose first term is n2 and whose common ratio is $${1 \over {{{(n + 1)}^2}}}$$. Then the value of 

$${1 \over {26}} + \sum\limits_{n = 1}^{50} {\left( {{S_n} + {2 \over {n + 1}} - n - 1} \right)} $$ is equal to ___________.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question: Let for n = 1, 2, ......, 50, S_{n} be the sum of the infinite geometric progression whose first term is n^{2} and whose common ratio is $${1 \over {{{(n + 1)}^2}}}$$. Then the value of $${1 \over {26}} + \sum\limits_{n = 1}^{50} {\left( {{S_n} + {2 \over {n + 1}} - n - 1} \right)} $$ is equal to ___________.

questions.question_text:
If the system of linear equations 
$$2x - 3y = \gamma  + 5$$, 
$$\alpha x + 5y = \beta  + 1$$, where $$\alpha$$, $$\beta$$, $$\gamma$$ $$\in$$ R has infinitely many solutions then the value 
of | 9$$\alpha$$ + 3$$\beta$$ + 5$$\gamma$$ | is equal to ____________.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question: If the system of linear equations $$2x - 3y = \gamma  + 5$$, $$\alpha x + 5y = \beta  + 1$$, where $$\alpha$$, $$\beta$$, $$\gamma$$ $$\in$$ R has infinitely many solutions then the value of | 9$$\alpha$$ + 3$$\beta$$ + 5$$\gamma$$ | is equal to ____________.

questions.subject: Mathematics

questions.question_text: Sum of squares of modulus of all the complex numbers z satisfying $$\overline z  = i{z^2} + {z^2} - z$$ is equal to ___________.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question: Sum of squares of modulus of all the complex numbers z satisfying $$\overline z  = i{z^2} + {z^2} - z$$ is equal to ___________.

questions.question_text: Let S = {1, 2, 3, 4}. Then the number of elements in the set { f : S $$\times$$ S $$\to$$ S : f is onto and f (a, b) = f (b, a) $$\ge$$ a $$\forall$$ (a, b) $$\in$$ S $$\times$$ S } is ______________.
questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question: Let S = {1, 2, 3, 4}. Then the number of elements in the set { f : S $$\times$$ S $$\to$$ S : f is onto and f (a, b) = f (b, a) $$\ge$$ a $$\forall$$ (a, b) $$\in$$ S $$\times$$ S } is ______________.

questions.question_text: Velocity (v) and acceleration (a) in two systems of units 1 and 2 are related as $${v_2} = {n \over {{m^2}}}{v_1}$$ and $${a_2} = {{{a_1}} \over {mn}}$$ respectively. Here m and n are constants. The relations for distance and time in two systems respectively are :
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: Velocity (v) and acceleration (a) in two systems of units 1 and 2 are related as $${v_2} = {n \over {{m^2}}}{v_1}$$ and $${a_2} = {{{a_1}} \over {mn}}$$ respectively. Here m and n are constants. The relations for distance and time in two systems respectively are :

questions.question_text: A ball is spun with angular acceleration $$\alpha$$ = 6t2 $$-$$ 2t where t is in second and $$\alpha$$ is in rads$$-$$2. At t = 0, the ball has angular velocity of 10 rads$$-$$1 and angular position of 4 rad. The most appropriate expression for the angular position of the ball is :
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A ball is spun with angular acceleration $$\alpha$$ = 6t^{2} $$-$$ 2t where t is in second and $$\alpha$$ is in rads^{$$-$$2}. At t = 0, the ball has angular velocity of 10 rads^{$$-$$1} and angular position of 4 rad. The most appropriate expression for the angular position of the ball is :

questions.question_text: A block of mass 2 kg moving on a horizontal surface with speed of 4 ms$$-$$1 enters a rough surface ranging from x = 0.5 m to x = 1.5 m. The retarding force in this range of rough surface is related to distance by F = $$-$$kx where k = 12 Nm$$-$$1. The speed of the block as it just crosses the rough surface will be :
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A block of mass 2 kg moving on a horizontal surface with speed of 4 ms^{$$-$$1} enters a rough surface ranging from x = 0.5 m to x = 1.5 m. The retarding force in this range of rough surface is related to distance by F = $$-$$kx where k = 12 Nm^{$$-$$1}. The speed of the block as it just crosses the rough surface will be :

questions.question_text:
A $$\sqrt {34} $$ m long ladder weighing 10 kg leans on a frictionless wall. Its feet rest on the floor 3 m away from the wall as shown in the figure. If Ef and Fw are the reaction forces of the floor and the wall, then ratio of $${F_w}/{F_f}$$ will be :

(Use g = 10 m/s2.)
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question:
A $$\sqrt {34} $$ m long ladder weighing 10 kg leans on a frictionless wall. Its feet rest on the floor 3 m away from the wall as shown in the figure. If E_{f} and F_{w} are the reaction forces of the floor and the wall, then ratio of $${F_w}/{F_f}$$ will be : 
(Use g = 10 m/s^{2}.)

questions.question_text:
Water falls from a 40 m high dam at the rate of 9 $$\times$$ 104 kg per hour. Fifty percentage of gravitational potential energy can be converted into electrical energy. Using this hydroelectric energy number of 100 W lamps, that can be lit, is :

(Take g = 10 ms$$-$$2)
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question:
Water falls from a 40 m high dam at the rate of 9 $$\times$$ 10^{4} kg per hour. Fifty percentage of gravitational potential energy can be converted into electrical energy. Using this hydroelectric energy number of 100 W lamps, that can be lit, is : 
(Take g = 10 ms^{$$-$$2})

questions.question_text: Two objects of equal masses placed at certain distance from each other attracts each other with a force of F. If one-third mass of one object is transferred to the other object, then the new force will be :
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: Two objects of equal masses placed at certain distance from each other attracts each other with a force of F. If one-third mass of one object is transferred to the other object, then the new force will be :

questions.question_text:
A water drop of radius 1 $$\mu$$m falls in a situation where the effect of buoyant force is negligible. Co-efficient of viscosity of air is 1.8 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$5 Nsm$$-$$2 and its density is negligible as compared to that of water 106 gm$$-$$3. Terminal velocity of the water drop is :

(Take acceleration due to gravity = 10 ms$$-$$2)
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question:
A water drop of radius 1 $$\mu$$m falls in a situation where the effect of buoyant force is negligible. Co-efficient of viscosity of air is 1.8 $$\times$$ 10^{$$-$$5} Nsm^{$$-$$2} and its density is negligible as compared to that of water 10^{6} gm^{$$-$$3}. Terminal velocity of the water drop is : 
(Take acceleration due to gravity = 10 ms^{$$-$$2})

questions.question_text: A sample of an ideal gas is taken through the cyclic process ABCA as shown in figure. It absorbs, 40 J of heat during the part AB, no heat during BC and rejects 60 J of heat during CA. A work of 50 J is done on the gas during the part BC. The internal energy of the gas at A is 1560 J. The workdone by the gas during the part CA is :
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A sample of an ideal gas is taken through the cyclic process ABCA as shown in figure. It absorbs, 40 J of heat during the part AB, no heat during BC and rejects 60 J of heat during CA. A work of 50 J is done on the gas during the part BC. The internal energy of the gas at A is 1560 J. The workdone by the gas during the part CA is :

questions.question_text: What will be the effect on the root mean square velocity of oxygen molecules if the temperature is doubled and oxygen molecule dissociates into atomic oxygen?
questions.subject: Physics

options.A: The velocity of atomic oxygen remains same
options.B: The velocity of atomic oxygen doubles
options.C: The velocity of atomic oxygen becomes half
options.D: The velocity of atomic oxygen becomes four times

questions.question: What will be the effect on the root mean square velocity of oxygen molecules if the temperature is doubled and oxygen molecule dissociates into atomic oxygen?

questions.question_text: Two point charges A and B of magnitude +8 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$6 C and $$-$$8 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$6 C respectively are placed at a distance d apart. The electric field at the middle point O between the charges is 6.4 $$\times$$ 104 NC$$-$$1. The distance 'd' between the point charges A and B is :
questions.subject: Physics

The electric field at the middle point O between the charges is 6.4 $$\times$$ 10^{4} NC^{$$-$$1}. The distance 'd' between the point charges A and B is :

questions.question_text:

(Assume the coil to be short circuited.)

The value of x will be :

questions.question_text: A student in the laboratory measures thickness of a wire using screw gauge. The readings are 1.22 mm, 1.23 mm, 1.19 mm and 1.20 mm. The percentage error is $${x \over {121}}\% $$. The value of x is ____________.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A student in the laboratory measures thickness of a wire using screw gauge. The readings are 1.22 mm, 1.23 mm, 1.19 mm and 1.20 mm. The percentage error is $${x \over {121}}\% $$. The value of x is ____________.

questions.question_text: A zener of breakdown voltage Vz = 8 V and maximum zener current, IZM = 10 mA is subjectd to an input voltage Vi = 10 V with series resistance R = 100 $$\Omega$$. In the given circuit RL represents the variable load resistance. The ratio of maximum and minimum value of RL is _____________.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A zener of breakdown voltage V_{z} = 8 V and maximum zener current, I_{ZM} = 10 mA is subjectd to an input voltage V_{i} = 10 V with series resistance R = 100 $$\Omega$$. In the given circuit R_{L} represents the variable load resistance. The ratio of maximum and minimum value of R_{L} is _____________.

questions.question_text: In a Young's double slit experiment, an angular width of the fringe is 0.35$$^\circ$$ on a screen placed at 2 m away for particular wavelength of 450 nm. The angular width of the fringe, when whole system is immersed in a medium of refractive index 7/5, is $${1 \over \alpha }$$. The value of $$\alpha$$ is ___________.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: In a Young's double slit experiment, an angular width of the fringe is 0.35$$^\circ$$ on a screen placed at 2 m away for particular wavelength of 450 nm. The angular width of the fringe, when whole system is immersed in a medium of refractive index 7/5, is $${1 \over \alpha }$$. The value of $$\alpha$$ is ___________.

questions.question_text: In the given circuit, the magnitude of VL and VC are twice that of VR. Given that f = 50 Hz, the inductance of the coil is $${1 \over {K\pi }}$$ mH. The value of K is ____________.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: In the given circuit, the magnitude of V_{L} and V_{C} are twice that of V_{R}. Given that f = 50 Hz, the inductance of the coil is $${1 \over {K\pi }}$$ mH. The value of K is ____________.

questions.question_text: All resistances in figure are 1 $$\Omega$$ each. The value of current 'I' is $${a \over 5}$$ A. The value of a is _________.

questions.question: All resistances in figure are 1 $$\Omega$$ each. The value of current 'I' is $${a \over 5}$$ A. The value of a is _________.

questions.question_text: A capacitor C1 of capacitance 5 $$\mu$$F is charged to a potential of 30 V using a battery. The battery is then removed and the charged capacitor is connected to an uncharged capacitor C2 of capacitance 10 $$\mu$$F as shown in figure. When the switch is closed charge flows between the capacitors. At equilibrium, the charge on the capacitor C2 is __________ $$\mu$$C.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A capacitor C_{1} of capacitance 5 $$\mu$$F is charged to a potential of 30 V using a battery. The battery is then removed and the charged capacitor is connected to an uncharged capacitor C_{2} of capacitance 10 $$\mu$$F as shown in figure. When the switch is closed charge flows between the capacitors. At equilibrium, the charge on the capacitor C_{2} is __________ $$\mu$$C.

questions.question_text:
A tunning fork of frequency 340 Hz resonates in the fundamental mode with an air column of length 125 cm in a cylindrical tube closed at one end. When water is slowly poured in it, the minimum height of water required for observing resonance once again is ___________ cm.

(Velocity of sound in air is 340 ms$$-$$1)
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question:
A tunning fork of frequency 340 Hz resonates in the fundamental mode with an air column of length 125 cm in a cylindrical tube closed at one end. When water is slowly poured in it, the minimum height of water required for observing resonance once again is ___________ cm. 
(Velocity of sound in air is 340 ms^{$$-$$1})

questions.question_text: A liquid of density 750 kgm$$-$$3 flows smoothly through a horizontal pipe that tapers in cross-sectional area from A1 = 1.2 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$2 m2 to A2 = $${{{A_1}} \over 2}$$. The pressure difference between the wide and narrow sections of the pipe is 4500 Pa. The rate of flow of liquid is ___________ $$\times$$ 10$$-$$3 m3s$$-$$1.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A liquid of density 750 kgm^{$$-$$3} flows smoothly through a horizontal pipe that tapers in cross-sectional area from A_{1} = 1.2 $$\times$$ 10^{$$-$$2} m^{2} to A_{2} = $${{{A_1}} \over 2}$$. The pressure difference between the wide and narrow sections of the pipe is 4500 Pa. The rate of flow of liquid is ___________ $$\times$$ 10^{$$-$$3} m^{3}s^{$$-$$1}.

questions.question_text:
A uniform disc with mass M = 4 kg and radius R = 10 cm is mounted on a fixed horizontal axle as shown in figure. A block with mass m = 2 kg hangs from a massless cord that is wrapped around the rim of the disc. During the fall of the block, the cord does not slip and there is no friction at the axle. The tension in the cord is ____________ N.

(Take g = 10 ms$$-$$2)
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question:
A uniform disc with mass M = 4 kg and radius R = 10 cm is mounted on a fixed horizontal axle as shown in figure. A block with mass m = 2 kg hangs from a massless cord that is wrapped around the rim of the disc. During the fall of the block, the cord does not slip and there is no friction at the axle. The tension in the cord is ____________ N. 
(Take g = 10 ms^{$$-$$2})

questions.question_text: A car covers AB distance with first one-third at velocity v1 ms$$-$$1, second one-third at v2 ms$$-$$1 and last one-third at v3 ms$$-$$1. If v3 = 3v1, v2 = 2v1 and v1 = 11 ms$$-$$1 then the average velocity of the car is _____________ ms$$-$$1.
questions.subject: Physics
questions.question: A car covers AB distance with first one-third at velocity v_{1} ms^{$$-$$1}, second one-third at v_{2} ms^{$$-$$1} and last one-third at v_{3} ms^{$$-$$1}. If v_{3} = 3v_{1}, v_{2} = 2v_{1} and v_{1} = 11 ms^{$$-$$1} then the average velocity of the car is _____________ ms^{$$-$$1}.
